title: Open311
body:
Open311 API Access

This platform implements the Open311 GeoReport v2 API standard, allowing developers to build applications that interact with our civic issue reporting system.

Getting Started

To access our Open311 API, you'll need to:

  • Browse available service types at /georeport/v2/services.json
  • View existing reports at /georeport/v2/requests.json
  • Submit new reports to /georeport/v2/requests.json using POST

Authentication

For read-only access, no authentication is required. To submit reports, you'll need to include your API key in the request.

Documentation

For full API documentation, visit the Open311 GeoReport v2 Wiki.

Example Applications

Check out these example applications built on our Open311 API:

  • Mobile reporting apps
  • Data visualization dashboards
  • Integration with 311 call centers

title: About
body:
About Mark-a-Spot

Mark-a-Spot is an open source platform for civic issue tracking and citizen engagement. Our mission is to create transparent, effective communication between citizens and local government.

Our Platform

This platform allows citizens to:

  • Report non-emergency issues in the community
  • Track the status of reported issues
  • View data about community needs and service delivery

How It Works

When you submit a report, it's sent to the relevant department for review. As your report is processed, you'll receive updates on its status. Once resolved, you'll be notified of the outcome.

Open Data

We believe in transparency. All reports submitted (excluding personal information) are publicly available through our interface and Open311 API. This data helps us identify patterns, allocate resources effectively, and measure our performance.

Technology

This platform is powered by Mark-a-Spot, a Drupal-based open source solution. Learn more at markaspot.de.
